text: Xanthostege plana is a moth in the family Crambidae. It was described by Augustus Radcliffe Grote in 1883. It is found in North America, where it has been recorded from Arizona and Texas. The forewings are dark yellow with a contrasting pinkish-red fringe. The hindwings are translucent stramineous (straw colored).Papilio 2 (9-10): 184 Adults are on wing from July to September. ==References== Category:Moths described in 1883 Category:Pyraustinae
title: Xanthostege plana
